speaker.whotheyare: Daniel Susskind explores the impact of technology, particularly artificial intelligence, on work and society.
speaker.whylisten: Daniel Susskind is the co-author, with Richard Susskind, of the best-selling book, The Future of the Professions, and a Fellow in Economics at Balliol College, Oxford University. He is currently finishing his latest book, on the future of work. Previously, he worked in the British Government -- as a policy adviser in the Prime Minister's Strategy Unit, as a policy analyst in the Policy Unit in 10 Downing Street, and as a senior policy adviser in the Cabinet Office. Susskind received a doctorate in economics from Oxford University and was a Kennedy Scholar at Harvard University.
